physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Emaciated facies and extremities; tensely protuberant abdomen; exuberant eruptive xanthomas covering the face, trunk, extremities, palms, and soles; milky infiltrates on the retina; liver edge extended to pelvic brim; no evidence of ascites; spleen not palpable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Skin xanthomas showed regression after the first two plasma exchange procedures; maximum lesions reduction at approximately 40 procedures; weight and appetite remained unchanged despite treatment.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Triglycerides: 109 mmol/liter (9670 mg/dl); Total cholesterol: 253 mmol/liter (978 mg/dl); HDL cholesterol: 0.54 mmol/liter (21 mg/dl)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe hypertriglyceridemia, visible body fat loss, and liver dysfunction.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Triglyceride levels decreased by 60-85% per plasma exchange; levels rebounded to baseline within 7 days post-exchange. Initial decrease in liver volume from 6905 ml to 5178 ml over one year.
